title: Dumping txs ?
body:
what does "Dumping txs" meaning?
why it's so slow?
how can I speed up?

thx！

my problem is I can't find the tx when the block number is not Dumping, why?
It’s creation of new snapshot in background. You don’t need to speedup
but why some on chain tx could not be found by eth_getTransactionByHash and could found by eth_getBlockByNumber?

and I found that, when snapshot file is creating, tx can not be found. 
ps: My node blockNumber is 0xf4e0f0(16048368)

![CleanShot 2022-11-26 at 01 06 05@2x](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/344530/204031043-9d2c1a63-e41f-4c1f-8987-f79cff461851.png)

> my problem is I can't find the tx when the block number is not Dumping, why?

It must not happen, but can be a bug. Node creating snapshot for blocks: 15.0m-15.5m

you searching for some recent transaction:  16048368

likely snapshots are not related to your problem. 

1. Show other logs (without DumpingTx)
2. Show “make integration” “integration print_stages”
3. You still can’t find it?
recent transaction can be founded. now other logs: integration print_stages log:

> Your —prune flags?

not have this flags

but yesterday I upgrade erigon show this log:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/344530/204071515-b4b077aa-432a-4ca5-aaf7-b07d90329f7e.png)
and I can search "prune" in log:

so. my advise: 
- wait for migration finish
- check that you still can't find that transaction
- stop erigon
- `make integration`
- `./build/bin/integration stage_tx_lookup --reset`
- `./build/bin/integration stage_tx_lookup`
- start erigon

> so. my advise:
> 
> * wait for migration finish
> * check that you still can't find that transaction
> * stop erigon
> * `make integration`
> * `./build/bin/integration stage_tx_lookup --reset`
> * `./build/bin/integration stage_tx_lookup`
> * start erigon

after do all this, it's fine now, thank you very much!
